action.action-desc: Mr. Mike Garcia of California introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to condition the eligibility of a State or jurisdiction in a State to receive Federal funds to support the administration of elections for Federal office in the State on having laws in effect that require voters to present a valid photo identification in order to receive or cast a ballot in such elections, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Voter Integrity and Defense Act.

section.header: Requiring photo identification law as condition of eligibility for Federal funds to support election administration

subsection.text: Subtitle D of title II of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 (52 U.S.C. 21001 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following new part:

part.header: Conditioning Eligibility for Funds on Laws Requiring Photo Identification for Voting

subsection.header: Requiring provision of photo identification for voting
subsection.text: A State or a jurisdiction in a State is not eligible to receive a payment from the Commission under this Act or any other Act unless the State or jurisdiction certifies to the Commission that the State has in effect a law that—

paragraph.text: prevents the appropriate State or local election official from providing a ballot for an election for Federal office to an individual who desires to vote in person unless the individual presents to the official a valid photo identification described in section 297A; and

prevents the appropriate State or local election official from accepting any ballot for an election for Federal office provided by an individual who votes other than in person unless the individual submits with the ballot a copy of a valid photo identification described in section 297A.

subsection.text: A State or jurisdiction is eligible to receive a payment if the State provides an exemption under the law described in subsection (a) for absent uniformed services voters under section 107(1) of the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act (52 U.S.C. 20310(1)).

section.text: A valid photo identification described in this section with respect to an individual is any of the following:

paragraph.text: A valid State-issued motor vehicle driver’s license that includes a photo of the individual and an expiration date.
A valid State-issued identification card that includes a photo of the individual and an expiration date.
A valid United States passport for the individual.
A valid military identification for the individual.
Any other form of government-issued identification that the State may specify as a valid photo identification for purposes of voting in an election for Federal office.

subsection.text: The table of contents of such Act is amended by adding at the end of the items relating to subtitle D of title II the following:

toc-quoted-entry.toc-entry: Part 7—Conditioning Payment of Funds on Laws Requiring Photo Identification for Voting

subsection.text: The amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to payments made on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
